title: Chana Masala (Indian Chickpea Curry) Recipe
description: Chana masala is easy to make with chickpeas, tomatoes, onion, green chile, ginger, and a flavorsome blend of spices for a delicious Indian curry.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Asian Indian Main Dishes Curry Chana Masala (Indian Chickpea Curry) 4.6 (215) 166 Reviews 52 Photos Give this chana masala dish a try and don't look back! This Indian chickpea curry features a hearty mixture of chickpeas, tomatoes, onion, green chili, and warm Indian spices. Both carnivores and vegetarians will enjoy this meal. My kids love it. Serve over basmati or jasmine rice and enjoy. Namaste y'all! Submitted by latinmama Updated on February 25, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 52 52 52 52 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 2 Yield: 2 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 onion, chopped 1 tomato, chopped 1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, peeled and chopped 4 cloves garlic, chopped, or more to taste 1 green chile pepper, seeded and chopped (Optional) 3 tablespoons olive oil 2 fresh bay leaves 1 teaspoon chili powder 1 teaspoon coriander powder 1 teaspoon garam masala ½ teaspoon turmeric powder 1 pinch salt to taste water, as needed 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas 1 teaspoon fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish, or more to taste Directions Grind onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, and chile pepper together in a food processor into a paste. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry bay leaves in hot oil until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour the paste into the skillet and cook until the oil begins to separate from the mixture and is golden brown in color, 2 to 3 minutes. Season the mixture with chili powder, coriander, gram masala, turmeric, and salt; cook and stir until very hot, 2 to 3 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir just enough water into the mixture to get a thick sauce; bring to a boil and stir chickpeas into the sauce. Reduce heat to medium and cook until the chickpeas are heated through, 5 to 7 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note Leave out the green chile if kiddies will be eating. Serve with a matar paneer recipe to round out this Indian dinner. As an optional serving suggestion, serve with Indian Naan Bread instead of rice. I Made It Print 576 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Chana Masala (Indian Chickpea Curry) 01 of 52 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 52 Photo by  Colleen F 02/24/2021 03 of 52 Photo by  Mike Carnevale 02/20/2021 04 of 52 Photo by  Lucifer 01/18/2021 05 of 52 Photo by  Paul Kasiola 09/14/2020 Very tasty and not too hard to make. I will make it again 06 of 52 Photo by  Casual Stalker 05/24/2020 All I have to say is super good! I've been trying more exotic cooking lately, and I'm really happy with how this tasted. 07 of 52 Photo by  Nikita 05/18/2020 This recipe was amazing! Made it yesterday for the family and had to make it again today! One thing I added in was 2 tbsp of brown sugar when I added the water because I wanted it to be a little sweet. I also used a 1/4 tsp of cayenne pepper instead of 1/2 tsp of chili and I used cumin powder instead of coriander. But I have this new found love of Indian food and I’ve been searching for simple recipes to try and this was the first of many. Thanks so much! 08 of 52 Photo by  Len 05/16/2020 09 of 52 Photo by  Connie Dewing 04/25/2020 I did change the prep but used all the ingredients listed. I minded the onion and cooked it and pureed the tomato garlic and ginger. Then added some sliced chicken. Everyone liked it. It was a bit spicier then my husband wanted it to be so next time I’ll leave that out. But the overall taste was great Also super simple to make, just assemble everything then start cooking 10 of 52 Photo by  Michael 12/31/2019 My wife and I finally purchased the missing seasonings for this and made it tonight. The aroma of the sauce/paste cooking in our small sauté pan. The instructions weren’t super clear but we figured it out easily enough. We used one of the suggestions of using canned tomatoes and chiles and added some cayenne pepper. We wanted this to be more filled if so we topped basmati rice with this and it’s a match made in heaven. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Chickpea Curry 647 Ratings Pumpkin Curry with Lentils and Apples 65 Ratings Bell Pepper, Tomato, and Potato Indian Curry 7 Ratings Vegan Japanese Turnip Curry 1 Rating Channa Masala (Chickpea Curry) 74 Ratings Batata Nu Shak (Potato Curry) 15 Ratings Vegan Butternut Squash and Chickpea Curry 3 Ratings Quick Vegetable Curry 17 Ratings Indian Curry Couscous with Broccoli and Edamame 8 Ratings Instant Pot® Vegan Korma 3 Ratings Rajma (Kidney Bean Curry) 58 Ratings Aloo Gobi 69 Ratings Jackfruit Curry (Kathal Subzi) 5 Ratings Bangaladumpa (Potato) Upma Koora 12 Ratings Black Chana with Potato 2 Ratings Doodhi Chana 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
